> Powered by [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/incubator-superset/pull/6575?src=pr&el=footer). Last update [d99b36e...d54750a](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/incubator-superset/pull/6575?src=pr&el=lastupdated). Read the [comment docs](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/pull-request-comments).
I  met the same problem

@ghsalem Not too familiar with Oracle syntax, but if I understood you correctly we can omit the CAST entirely, resulting in e.g. `'PT1M': "TRUNC({col}, 'MI')",`? Tried it out, and seems to work fine, too. Still wondering if there might have been some reason for the `TO_DATE()` being there..

Btw, if you want to locally override the built-in timegrains in `db_engine_spec.py`, you can just add the following to `superset_config.py`:

```python
TIME_GRAIN_ADDON_FUNCTIONS = {
    'oracle': {
        None: '{col}',
        'PT1S': 'CAST({col} as DATE)',
        'PT1M': "TRUNC({col}, 'MI')",
        'PT1H': "TRUNC({col}, 'HH')",
        'P1D': "TRUNC({col}, 'DDD')",
        'P1W': "TRUNC({col}, 'WW')",
        'P1M': "TRUNC({col}, 'MONTH')",
        'P0.25Y': "TRUNC({col}, 'Q')",
        'P1Y': "TRUNC({col}, 'YEAR')",
    },
}
```
所以现在还是不能给不同的用户分配看不同的看板吗，并且不能修改

@villebro As you verified, removing the CAST altogether works, but only if COL is of type DATE or TIMESTAMP. Keeping CAST will cater for cases where COL is in fact a string representing dates in some format. As I said in my previous message, the format has to be set at the session level.
Thanks for the hint about superset_config.py.

Same issue @nuria 

@mistercrunch Can you re-open this issue?

@ghsalem Right you are, retaining `CAST` inside `TRUNC` does in fact support even string dates, so your original proposal seems to support `DATE`, `TIMESTAMP` and `CHAR`, very nice. I did some digging and wasn't able to find any real reason for going with the nested `TO_DATE` expression, so I'm guessing the original Oracle time grain PR #1544 didn't consider the possibility of using `TIMESTAMP`.

Are you sure you don't feel up to the task of putting through a PR? This page seems to have a fairly good tutorial to get you going: https://www.javahelps.com/2017/04/git-pull-request-complete-guide-for.html
@villebro , thanks for the pointer. Just finished the thing.

Same issue @nuria :( 
Is there a quick fix for this one?
@ghsalem I don't think you need the long comment, the log will keep a record of the person who did the change and the original PR. Removing it should fix the linting error.
pip install superset==0.28.0rc7 didn't solve the issue
Looks like there was a trailing whitespace left where the comment was. Remove that and flake8 should be ok.
Should be ok now. I really need to get more in this github dev thing, so that I can check these by myself.

We're currently recommending running `0.29.0rc7` where this issue is fixed. We're held up on releases until we can spend cycles sorting out LICENSE related documentation to comply with the ASF for official releases.
Sorry I meant `0.29.0rc7`
@jeffcumt let's use english as the main language for this repo

Even after including the babel node separately, I couldn't resolve it. So i had to install @babel/preset-env, @babel/preset-react 
`npm install -- save-dev @babel/node`
`npm install -- save-dev @babel/preset-env`
`npm install -- save-dev @babel/preset-react `

and change the presets on the .babelrc like below to fix the issue.
`"presets" : ["@babel/preset-env","@babel/preset-react"],`
This looks like it was superseded by another PR; closing.
Oh snap, never saw this PR...
https://github.com/apache/incubator-superset/pull/6573 should help
Fixed in master

Were you able to solve the issue? I am facing the exact same issue.
@williaster thanks for the review! I addressed all comments and rebased
Being able to use D3's time-format as @craigappl described above would definitely be helpful.
Unfortunately I couldn't find a fix for this and it forced me to install 0.29 version of superset (0.29rc7). This feature works well there.

In my case, "python 2.7.5 + superset 0.26.3" works fine
but "python 3.6.3 + superset 0.28.1" doesn't work(there were no error log).
So I did roll back...

Well... I used same "map box api key" and I also checked "statistics" in my Mapbox account page.
Even though there were request for "python 3.6.3 + superset 0.28.1", I couldn't see my data on map.
these are map ids in my Mapbox-statistics page
- mapbox.mapbox-terrain-v2
mapbox.mapbox-streets-v7
It trips on the line that goes `batch_op.create_foreign_key('user_id', 'ab_user', ['user_id'], ['id'])` in `superset/migrations/versions/2591d77e9831_user_id.py`. Which database engine are you using?
sqlite
We build against sqlite on Travis, so there has to be something else that's funky about your setup...
Is there any hack to do bar chart using ascending sort?

I try to visualize bad performing products using the bar chart. But it is not possible because of this default "ORDER BY sum__num DESC". 

Is there any hack to do "ORDER BY sum__num ASC"?

@PushHandle I had the same question,Could you tell me how to solve the problem?

@aboganas I also had problems when deploying this, but it eventually went through after I killed some processes in MySQL. I assumed in my case it was taking too long because of the size of the table.

I tested on a clean install and it works fine. @mistercrunch any idea why this could be hanging?

There's another script that runs a similar command (https://github.com/apache/incubator-superset/blob/46c86672c8320c0003c2eb26f73db6daa2767996/superset/migrations/versions/956a063c52b3_adjusting_key_length.py#L18).
I left it running and it went through after like 8 hours. so maybe as you said there was a process holding it up
Thanks! @aboganas
Refer this if getting above issue [https://github.com/apache/incubator-superset/issues/6543](url)
I resolved the merge conflicts with the last commits
Can you try `0.29.0rc7`? `pip install superset==0.29.0rc7`
@williaster  Can we first merge this pr? so it will be easy for me to send a second PR about tablevis to this branch.
Yep! merging now.

I agree with @thinmatt that we need an additional UI element to indicate the panel is resizable.  Also agree with making "the SQL toolbar visually match up with the editor pane -- that way the resizer is the true visual edge of the editor pane".

How about this, which would accomplish both of the above without introducing buttons overlaid on query text?

![sql lab pull](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2992086/50664846-53958e80-0f63-11e9-89a7-5439c08ecb85.png)

We could also consider, as @vylc mentioned, moving the action buttons to the lower right where the current "parameters" and timer are, but I think that update addresses a different issue than this ticket.

I like @dorq 's proposal. The color difference between the light and dark grey should serve as a natural divide between code and the button area (i.e. code in the light grey area only). When the scorbar comes up, it would only scroll the code area.
 
I'm not sure where we want to left-align the 'Run Query' button. It looks a bit odd somehow to me to have it aligned "into the gutter" (now that the button area is the same grey, the left end of it looks like an extension of the gutter to me). 

I was thinking perhaps we could align it to the right side of the gutter. As @thinmatt pointed out, the gutter of the ace editor (code area) resizes based on the digits of the line number so in order to align the buttons to the right side of the gutter, we would need to reposition the buttons as the code area grows, which is silly. One possible way around it is to push all the buttons to the right. Perhaps?

I like the idea of pushing all the buttons to the right.  A couple of questions following up on that...

- Are the "parameters" button and time functionally different than the other buttons?  Would we want to keep them in a separate group from the other buttons?
- Would we want to reverse the order of the buttons so that the default "Run Query" is at the far right?

cc @vylc

Here's what the buttons look like indented to the right side of the gutter (even though we won't do exactly this), in case it's helpful:
![sql lab pull - indent](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2992086/50669245-e3920300-0f78-11e9-8d84-f9e7c2da46d4.png)

We could try a subtle top border to the buttons container to distinguish it from the gutter:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2992086/50669354-8cd8f900-0f79-11e9-8ef7-d9f0bd01165d.png)

This also helps denote the scroll area.

@mistercrunch  It can be successfully installed superset-0.29.0rc7,but I want to build local development environment following instructions here :https://github.com/apache/incubator-superset/blob/0.29.0rc7/CONTRIBUTING.md,Then  i got errors when  Install external dependencies using pip install -r requirements.txt

There are 3 errors:
1、Failed building wheel for cchardet
2、 Failed building wheel for sasl
3、Command "/Users/victorli/PycharmProjects/incubator-superset/venv/bin/python -u -c "import setuptools, tokenize;__file__='/private/var/folders/sx/8tjrn2vd2b9gtyk_t446fj5w0000gn/T/pip-install-4lr4m6vn/cchardet/setup.py';f=getattr(tokenize, 'open', open)(__file__);code=f.read().replace('\r\n', '\n');f.close();exec(compile(code, __file__, 'exec'))" install --record /private/var/folders/sx/8tjrn2vd2b9gtyk_t446fj5w0000gn/T/pip-record-h9y97u_d/install-record.txt --single-version-externally-managed --compile --install-headers /Users/victorli/PycharmProjects/incubator-superset/venv/include/site/python3.6/cchardet" failed with error code 1 in /private/var/folders/sx/8tjrn2vd2b9gtyk_t446fj5w0000gn/T/pip-install-4lr4m6vn/cchardet/
Did you install xcode?

Recently I tweaked the CSS at tiny bit in an unrelated PR. I made the separation brand-blue (though low opacity) and made it a bit wider. Not sure if that's enough. We should probably also empty the content of the boxes while dragging to prevent the bad lags.

I don't think it's great/ideal by any mean, but a tiny bit more discoverable than before.

![durtjlllq1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/487433/50675943-2ddda900-0fa6-11e9-90d3-435304447a31.gif)
@mistercrunch  Xcode Version 10.1 (10B61)

@mistercrunch 

git checkout 0.28.1
git cherry-pick b4a19833035393857b11e0aec3ce62c6e0681dd1

using the above filtering issues seems to be solved. But Time Series - Line Chart is still not working. does not show any error. simply doesn't show anything.

is there any working version? (greater than 0.28)
End of last year (mid december) i have tried 0.29 also, but if i remember well my dashboard became very slow and threw time outs.
For windows location is venv\Lib\site-packages\superset\static\assets\images
Thanks! :)

Thanks @mistercrunch!  I agree that we should be careful about the lag while dragging; thanks for pointing that out.  I do still think we want to add a visible handle and improve the grouping of the buttons with the query text area, to make this even more discoverable and intuitive.

Thanks, we have the same problem too

Thanks again! 
Damir
Ping! I'd like to get this through.

Does anybody know if this feature will be in the next release? 
Thanks

re: button organization and placement - we should probably table that right now since there will be even more with lightweight pipeline functionality. Ideally (not in any particular order): Group 1 - Execute: Run query, Run query & create table Group 2 - Do something with SQL: Save query, share query Group 3 - Advanced SQL Editing: Parameterize query, possible UDF stuff Group 4 - Advanced Execute: Backfill, Schedule, Make Dependent I think we tackle in this order: (1) Add grip bar/handle to existing separator w/out touching buttons (image) (2) Figure out where we want to place buttons, whether or not that's in the SQL editor, an extended part of the gray area from the editor, etc. (3) Button re-org
